title: apparantly warding wins games. just played a game as urgot and had the place lighted up light chist

body:
just played a game as urgot and had the place lighted up light chistmas (or a rabbits bedroom in spring ;)) and we still  friggen LOST THE GAME.
RIOT IF I WARD I SHOULD WIN THE ENEMY TEAM HAD PLACED 50 wards between them yet i placed 107 on my own. why add wards if they dont win games.
i watched the video and tried urgot Jungler, now i consider myself a decent jungler and i used everythinh to ward so how can i lose? fek ur game sucks if you cant make wards a  winnign factor. maybe for every ward u place u get 5 M'cHappy points and when you get 10 M'cHappy points you get a free nugget from Tyrones Taco Deli, courtesy of rito games. or just Nicki minaj to personally take a dump on their chest (trust me she is loaded)

replies.body:
Perhaps because taking "warding wins games" to such an extreme is unreasonable, 50 wards between the team may be enough to get that team to win, each team needs to ward to their requirements.

One team may not do so well because of bad communication so they ward and then boom, they start winning because they no longer need to communicate as much; another team may place 25 ward and still win because they have very good communication.

Besides this warding is more so an extension of map awareness so the better your map awareness the less wards you will need to place which in turn should put more money in your pocket (if only marginally) this in turn puts better items in your hands faster which makes your kills easier which snowballs it somewhat; so it is also possible to take "warding wins games" to an extent where your warding has an adverse effect, placing 107 wards in one game (depending on game length and character role) may be too many making you spend more money on wards and less on items to get you kills.
becoz theyre not the real asnwer

This poll is OP.

Why do "strong" and "godlike" start with lower case tho, unlike the other 2?
